column4: can anyone determine this symptom:  I cannot SSH to my server (fatal error) from PuTTY.  And I cannot get to my homepage from the server, but I can ping the server.  I'm at work and SSH is the only connection that I use to gain access.  Any ideas?
correction:  PuTTY stating "Connection Refused" for an SSH connection to my server
you should try to nmap your server to see what ports are open
nmap?  I'm not familiar with that.
the server is behind a firewall, the only ports open for it are 22, 80, and the email ports
so if it can't connect, either the service isn't running or its firewalled right?
what OS are you on?
OS, ubuntu 8.10 server.  No GUI installed
so sudo apt-get install nmap
I'll have to do that when someone can reboot it.
its a network scanner, so it will tell you for sure that status of the machines exposed ports
oh, you mean what I'm running right now
yeh
the nmap command would be 'nmap -sS -P0 -sV -O <target>'
windowsxp sp3
where target is your servers ip
good, I copied the command, downloading the windows version to run a check.  I believe I turned off the UDP in the firewall
sweet, that sounds like the problem :)
but it's always been off.
once someone get's to the location I'll have them hard reboot the box.  It's uptime is over 60days.
yeah sounds like somethings broken there.. software firewall or hardware?
looks like software.  I'll have someone reboot it once they get there
if it was hardware, than I wouldn't be able to ping it.
